message: we're focusing only on developers
last week we added PGP and SSH keys that you can access
@alexbaldwin add some links to example profile pages of popular people, so that people have an idea how it would look after creating a profile page
http://whyhello.im
@krisrak we had that last week, but took them out while we develop a directory. speaking of which how would you guys categorize developers (ruby, javascript, etc.)?
How is it different than all those other sites - http://about.me for example?
You could pull the user image and assorted data via OpenID or Gravatar. Or, like here, from Twitter, Facebook, whatever…

hey guys I posted a simple HTML/CSS template for developers to make profile/resume pages on github and hacker news awhile back and got an awesome response. in order to make it easier for developers (and be able to keep adding updates without pull requests) we turned it into an app
thanks guys
if you could take a minute to test it out and give me any feedback, my developer and I (I'm the designer) would love to iterate this and make it something more useful for our developers
signing up now
one piece of feedback: the username field isn't obvious
http://whyhello.im/alexbaldwin and http://whyhello.com/amanelis are ours
@dominik we have github authentication and pulling of data ~75% done, totally agree
i wouldn't pre-populate the field with the base url because it's not obvious that you're supposed to add to it. i would put the base url to the left of the field instead.
@commanda thank you so much (try resizing your browser or using it on an iphone/ipad)
@alexbaldwin Web - PHP, Pyton, Ruby. Mobile - iOS, Android, PalmOS, WP7 ...
np! beautiful design, btw
you could try integrating with this service http://www.dandyid.org/ - i use it on my site
media queries > static sized about.me
@krisrak that list is gonna get out of control soon
added some more features on http://whyhello.im check it out and again post any feedback here or to @alexbaldwin on twitter
just added support for contact's through an email form, let me know anything else we can add for you
you  can link to your blog now thanks to @amanelis
Love this. Simple idea, nicely executed.
@DaveJ thanks dave!
@alexbaldwin You should use the RSS icon and put it along the other ones… ;)
@levifig gorgeous, I'll try it out
http://whyhello.im/alexbaldwin
I gots teh links
markdown is now live
This is actually pretty cool. http://whyhello.im/luke
test
@clone1018 so happy you figured out to use markdown now!
Although 2 ads for the site seems a bit unnecessary.
@clone1018 most badass panda. ever.
@clone1018 what do you mean?
Oh nvm. At first glance I thought that was a signup text at the bottom.
For unregistered users there's the signup button on top of a profile and there's the copyright at the bottom.
Love it. http://whyhello.im/chris
@chrisledet chris, stop playing starcraft for a minute and upload a different background pic!
how many developers are on this team?
@clone1018 no worries man
@mrudoy its just @amanelis and then I do the css/html
Cool app. http://whyhello.im/nate
@alexbaldwin Cool, good point, it was effortless to setup a profile.
This is great!  Why do you authenticate with the linked services, to verify identity?
our goal is 30 seconds to a minute
More like lazy developer proof it >;D
@samn we're working on making it EVEN easier. need to mom-proof this thing
not really
just to make it easier
@nateflink thanks nate! looking good!!!
I don't want to have to remember my github link
@samn it takes about ~2 minutes to set up a profile, rather than ~5-10 minutes before we set up authentication
@mal well then we would never be done ;)
update: changed to have 3 layouts, desktop, notebook, and mobile (tested on macbook pro, ipad, and iphone 4)
changes should be live after a bit more testing
thanks to @wezfurlong I changed the way slogans / subtitles work
@ved_antani yes that's actually a feature. try resizing your browser to all different sizes (shouldn't ever break the image, how's that for responsive?)
Also the images stretch and lose their pixel perfectness...
for eg. http://whyhello.im/ved on a large monitor- the background is stretched.
@ved_antani you should see the sharktopus if someone doesn't have a background?
Default images would help too if people dont have backgrounds to put.
Thats not a good example lol. That picture is like 1024 × 667 :P
@clone1018 - yeah - that was just to test the stretching ...:)
new changes are live. will you guys please test the responsive layout (resize your browser big to small) http://whyhello.im THANK YOU
thanks to your feedback, we've made "Contact Me" and "My Blog" icons rather than their own buttons. keep it real and let us know if we can improve
@alexbaldwin really like the site, sent you an email
@akuril didn't get anything from you?
@alexbaldwin Maybe it's been mentioned before, but will we be able to link to new services in the future? E.g. Google Account, SourceForge profile, etc.

@dideler yeah of course, anything that uses OAuth we can integrate with. @amanelis is cooking up some fun things. right now we are fixing some janky UX/UI. if you list what you want we can look at adding them

I'll second the additional default backgrounds comment. Also, it would be nice if after I added a service, you hide the icon from that service in the Add Service section http://cl.ly/2i2P3a0v2o0d340u1R3E
@ryduh good suggestion, I'll see if we can do that in the next batch
just pushed a new update live
http://whyhello.im
any feedback on the new UX would be very appreciated
why is there a get your own button at the top right of the landing page that just takes you back to the same page?
@an_ice_block Good Q
@bhellman1 yes that is a good question, it was just implemented for when people land on other pages... I'll get on that
I was imagining I'd be able to put in my github username and have a github projects widget.  Maybe some sort of portfolio widget.

I like the choice of url (I signed up a few days ago to test everything out), but honestly I don't get it.  How is this not just a direct copy of about.me?  The "aimed at developers bit", why would I want another about.me? Anywho, at least you have the feature set to copy from.  At least you know the model and the exit works (e.g. - http://goo.gl/yCkjf). Good luck!
Autosave > typing, changing "tabs", realizing my changes weren't saved.
Ooops; typo: "Your Blog \n So them what your created"
@jramphis there is no model or exit, this is just something we built because developers have shitty websites and about.me is a pain in the ass and owned by aol
@thetylerhayes oh... sorry about that, its not layed out to save tabs like that though. maybe next batch
@cdmoyer care to elaborate?
@mal one of those things that happens when you have late night coding sessions :( we'll fix it
It'd be kinda nice to be able to have analytics, preferably our own (e.g. I use Reinvigorate)
@alexbaldwin what about about.me is a pain in the ass?

@alexbaldwin what about autosaving each text field (or really any form's children that take input) upon loss of focus? e.g. i type my name > tab to the next field > site recognizes focus has changed elements > site autosaves new input from step 1
@levifig analytics isn't too hard, we're just working on other things at the moment. definitely a good idea (I'll work on it when you guys actually start promoting your profiles)
@thetylerhayes that would be gorgeous, we lost a lot of time trying to do edit in place, I'll pass that along to @amanelis

@thetylerhayes this is just a respost on why we're different. 1) were not run by AOL 2) everything we do is optimized for developers 3) our layouts are responsive 4) we let you use markdown in your bio 5) github auth 6) we will respond and implement good feedback in hours 7) whyhello works on mobile 8) you have zero design options besides your picture (sorry developers MOST of you shouldn't design and you know it) 9) our error messages involve food 10) instead of sucking your services into our platform, we use links as the internet was intended. linkjuice, gonna let it loose
@alexbaldwin hahaha Now, a hosted version would be nice! We–developers–run our own servers and kinda have a hard time trusting someone else's backend… :p
@levifig no way dude, kinda defeats the purpose of making a profile in < 1 minute
@alexbaldwin Good point! I was just suggesting an ALTERNATIVE not a replacement… :p
@levifig ah got it, why don't you guys trust other developers. are there really that many shitty programmers out there?
@micrypt Thanks dude!
@alexbaldwin Yes. You guys are cool though. ^^
haha we've worked with them too, theres a ton of people I wouldn't trust with a server
@commanda got it bookmarked, thank you so much for the help
@commanda the field shouldn't be prepopulated, it's a bg image done with css. I'll try pulling it out though
@commanda really? any suggestion on how to make it better?
@alexbaldwin haha Good point! ;) I never said I didn't… Just stating the "obvious" :)
